Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

New Young Adult books for May 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Apr 20, 2017

New titles from Rae Earl, Tanya Landman, Patrick Ness and more.

Island by Nicky Singer

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Apr 20, 2017

Kate found Island a category-defying tale, well worth a read.

The Liar's Handbook by Keren David

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Apr 18, 2017

In The Liar's Handbook, a funny, engaging and determined character with a penchant for storytelling investigates his mum's new boyfriend's lies.

The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time by Mark Haddon

Written by Olivia Roberts · Published Apr 11, 2017

The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time features an "amazing plot and characters"

A Tragic Kind of Wonderful by Eric Lindstrom

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Apr 6, 2017

A Tragic Kind of Wonderful deals convincingly with bipolar disorder, friendships, relationships and sexuality.

A Girl Named Digit by Annabel Monaghan

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Apr 4, 2017

A Girl Named Digit has it all: adventure, mystery, love and humour

New Young Adult books for April 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Mar 29, 2017

New titles from Jenny McLachlan, Brigid Kemmerer and Jeff Zentner

Welcome To Nowhere by Elizabeth Laird

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 23, 2017

Welcome to Nowhere is an immensely well-researched book that fearlessly tackles a worldwide issue.

We Come Apart by Sarah Crossan & Brian Conaghan

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Mar 9, 2017

Emma found We Come Apart beautifully written, heartbreaking but at the same time wonderful to read.

Life in a Fishbowl by Len Vlahos

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Mar 7, 2017

In Life in a Fishbowl, Len Vlahos creates "a bittersweet fusion of emotions that wonâ€™t let you go."

Find your next read on the 2017 YA Book Prize shortlist

Written by Alice Violett · Published Mar 2, 2017

The shortlist for The YA Book Prize was announced on THursday 2 March. This award "celebrates great books for teenagers and young adults and aims to get more teens reading."

Stoke High School Friday Book Club review their latest reads

Written by Stoke High School book club · Published Mar 2, 2017

Looking for your next YA read? These short reviews from Stoke High School students might help you decide.

New Young Adult books for March 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Feb 28, 2017

Featuring new titles from Emma Moss, Holly Smale and Susin Nielsen.

Murder in Midwinter by Fleur Hitchcock

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Feb 21, 2017

Emily recommends Murder in Midwinter to pre-teens looking for a taste of mystery and suspense

Recommended Young Adult titles to mark LGBT History Month 2017

Written by Alice Violett · Published Feb 9, 2017

To mark LGBT History Month 2017, we've compiled a huge list of LGBT-related titles for young adults

The Graces by Laure Eve

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Feb 7, 2017

Library volunteer Emily found The Graces dreamy, dark, enigmatic and unputdownable.

New Young Adult books for February 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Feb 1, 2017

Featuring Life in a Fishbowl, We Come Apart, Traitor to the Throne, All About Mia, Fir and Silver Stars

The Making of Mollie by Anna Carey

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jan 24, 2017

Emily found The Making of Mollie "an interesting historical novel, with a splash of girl power added for good measure."

Blame by Simon Mayo

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Dec 27, 2016

Kate recommends this young adult novel to teens and adults alike

Panic by Lauren Oliver

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Dec 22, 2016

Panic meets Lauren Oliver's usual high standards of characterisation and realism.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
